PageTitle: peer as-path-filter export (BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer as-path-filter export command configures a route-filter based on the AS_Path for the routes to be advertised to a peer group.
The undo peer as-path-filter export command cancels this configuration. The peer as-path-filter export command configures a route-filter based on the AS_Path for the routes to be advertised to a peer group. The undo peer as-path-filter export command cancels this configuration. By default, no policy based on an AS_Path list is configured for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to peers in a peer group, and all the BGP routes will be advertised to the peer group. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Specifies the number of the AS_Path filter.
The value is a decimal integer ranging from 1 to 256.

Specifies the name of an AS_Path filter.
The value is a string of 1 to 51 case-sensitive characters. If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo: When the peer as-path-filter export command is run to apply a routing policy to the BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group, the AS_Path filter filters out unqualified routes.
